author: speyeker

text:
I've been playing this game on and off for almost 2 years and I'm maybe halfway through. The game is kind of repetitive...town, dungeon, town, dungeon, town, dungeon, Gades, town... The music is great at times and mediocre at others. The characters aren't bad, but their maturity makes them a bit boring.

One of these days I will finish the game. But so far it is way outclassed by Chrono Trigger.

Though I will admit I love the puzzles so far.

author: serpenttao

text: Actually Gades is quite simple to beat. All you need to do is be able to buff up enough in the battle to make Guy and Selan able to withstand one of his hits. And then have Selan use the mind ring every turn (gives you access to stronger for a very reasonable amount of IP). Then you just need to hack away with Guy until he falls dead. I was ~lvl 24 when I did this I think.
author: xXZertulXx

text: If you kill him, he drops Gades Blade, one of the strongest swords in the game. It has the octostrike-ability, making Guy slash 8 times in a row when you use it. Imba.
